elements.title: a Michigan TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Michigan TV station rescued and restored a weather ball (pictured) that had been sitting for years in a scrapyard?

elements.title: in Liberia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Liberia, self-induced abortions are performed with herbal remedies known as "rocket-propelled grenade" and "Christmas leaf"?

elements.title: Valentin Houinato (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic judoka Valentin Houinato is also a full-time journalist?

elements.title: a cocoa cartel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ghana and Ivory Coast have been accused of setting up a cocoa cartel?

elements.title: a man who won his first international competition aged 30 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the triathletes competing in the 2024 Summer Olympics include a man who won his first international competition aged 30 and the brother of a former Olympian?

elements.title: Carlos Bandeirense Mirandópolis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Wikipedia hoax Carlos Bandeirense Mirandópolis was cited in a judicial decision by the Rio de Janeiro Court of Justice?

elements.title: Alyssa Mendoza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alyssa Mendoza and Andy Barat are the first Olympic representatives of their sport for their state and country, respectively?

elements.title: born without the ability to smell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one in ten thousand individuals are born without the ability to smell?

elements.title: Sizzle Ohtaka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sizzle Ohtaka, known as the "Queen of Commercial Songs", was producing them at a rate of ten per month?
